abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Additional Financing for
            the Education Sector Development Project for Sri Lanka were
            as follows: outcomes were satisfactory; risk to development
            outcome was moderate; Bank performance was satisfactory and
            borrower performance was also satisfactory. Some lessons
            learned includes: the capacity of the provincial education
            authorities was substantially strengthened by the Technical
            Support Unit (TSU) of the Finance Commission (FC). More
            responsibilities and administrative powers were given to
            provinces. The impact evaluation clearly shows that the
            quality and efficiency of the service delivery has been
            enhanced through the Program for School Improvement (PSI). A
            strong monitoring and evaluation mechanism is a key for
            project success. The high level monthly monitoring meeting
            was possible because of the robust data monitoring systems
            with the strong support from high officials of the
            government. The project is sandwiched by two education
            sector review reports.
